docs.snippet: It’s a sad day when the International Olympic Committee cannot even meet one of the lowest bars for a potential Winter Games host city: snow....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s a sad day when the International Olympic Committee cannot even meet one of the lowest bars for a potential Winter Games host city: snow.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of the Times column chides International Olympic Committee for choosing Beijing as site of 2022 Winter Games; notes that mountains to be used in skiing competitions are far from city and have minimal annual snowfall; suggests that commercial interests were put before practicality or concerns about China's record on human rights.

headline.main: At the 2022 Winter Olympics, No Snow Is No Problem for the I.O.C.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

docs.snippet: On one of London's most exclusive streets, the drivers of some expensive cars are getting ready to leave their parking spots....
docs.lead_paragraph: On one of London's most exclusive streets, the drivers of some expensive cars are getting ready to leave their parking spots.

headline.main: London Borough Seeks Crackdown on Noisy Supercars
headline.print_headline: London Borough Seeks Crackdown on Noisy Supercars

docs.snippet: The Chinese capital beat the Kazakh city in an International Olympic Committee vote and will be the first city to host both the Summer and Winter Games....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Chinese capital beat the Kazakh city in an International Olympic Committee vote and will be the first city to host both the Summer and Winter Games.
docs.abstract: Beijing wins bid for 2022 Winter Olympics, beating only other contender,  Almaty, Kazakhstan, by slim margin; will become only city in history of modern Olympics to have hosted both Summer and Winter Games; Beijing officials plan to construct high-speed railroad linking city to distant mountains where vast artificial snow-making operation will enable skiing events to be held.

headline.main: Beijing Defeats Almaty in Bid to Host 2022 Winter Olympics
headline.print_headline: Goliath Edges David, as Beijing Lands 2022 Winter Games

byline.contributor: Javier C. Hernández contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Ruslan Medelbek from Almaty, Kazakhstan. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

docs.snippet: Behind all the sports and smiles is an urgent human rights mission....
docs.lead_paragraph: Behind all the sports and smiles is an urgent human rights mission.
docs.abstract: Lawrence Downes Editorial Observer praises good will and inclusion on display in Special Olympics, but contends competitions masks fact that people with intellectual disabilities still face discrimination and lack of resources in daily life; acknowledges efforts of organizers to address serious issue of rights for disabled people, while putting on feel-good face.

headline.main: Special Olympics and the Burden of Happiness
headline.print_headline: Special Olympics and the Burden of Happiness

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

docs.snippet: Despite a few reservations, a proud nationalism was much in evidence across China after the selection of Beijing to host the 2022 Winter Olympics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a few reservations, a proud nationalism was much in evidence across China after the selection of Beijing to host the 2022 Winter Olympics.
docs.abstract: International Olympic Committee's selection of Beijing as host of 2022 Winter Games underscores China's growing clout worldwide; most citizens are optimistic that Games will boost national economy and that their own situations will be improved.

headline.main: 2022 Olympics Leave China Beaming From Its Growing Clout
headline.print_headline: A Beaming Nation With Growing Clout

byline.contributor: Cherie Chan and Yufan Huang contributed research.

docs.snippet: The World Health Organization has asked the IOC to analyze virus levels in Rio de Janeiro's Olympic waters, and the governing body of world sailing says it will start doing its own independent virus tests....
docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization has asked the IOC to analyze virus levels in Rio de Janeiro's Olympic waters, and the governing body of world sailing says it will start doing its own independent virus tests.

headline.main: WHO and Sailing Body Seek Virus Tests in Rio Olympic Venues
headline.print_headline: WHO and Sailing Body Seek Virus Tests in Rio Olympic Venues
